p: Over several decades, South Korea has ranked as one of the developed countries with the largest consumption of alcohol in the world [ 1, 2]. Alcohol-related liver disease is a broad-spectrum disease entity, including hepatic steatosis, hepatitis, cirrhosis, and hepatocellular carcinoma, as one individual can have various progressive stages of liver damage. Among them, alcoholic hepatitis has the worst prognosis, with short-term mortality of 40% within 1 month of onset [ 3– 5].
